intro: Sarcanthus affinis, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in temperate climates. The plant produces showy, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Sarcanthus affinis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
